text: The Orlando Open was a golf tournament on the PGA Tour from 1945 to 1947. It was played at Dubsdread Country Club in Orlando, Florida. The 1947 event went to a playoff after Jimmy Demaret, Dave Douglas and Herman Keiser were tied on 274 after the 72 holes. There was an 18-hole playoff the following day. Douglas and Demaret were again tied on 71 with Keiser taking 73. There was then a sudden-death playoff with Douglas winning with a birdie 3 at the first extra hole. ==Winners== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%" !Year!!Player!!Country!!Score!!To par!!Margin of victory!!Runner(s)-up!!Winner's share ($)!!Ref |- | 1947 || Dave Douglas || || align=center|274 || align=center|−10 || Playoff || Jimmy Demaret Herman Keiser || align=right|2,000 || |- | 1946 || Harry Todd || || align=center|275 || align=center|−9 || 1 stroke || Johnny Palmer || align=right|2,000 || |- | 1945 || Ben Hogan || || align=center|270 || align=center|−14 || 6 strokes || Jug McSpaden Johnny Revolta || align=right|2,000 || |} ==References== Category:Former PGA Tour events Category:Golf in Florida
